title: 104_hr3156
content: The "Voluntary Adoption Protection Act" amends the Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 to include provisions regarding involuntary removal from the Indian community and termination of parental rights. It emphasizes the protection of children from involuntary separation. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to define 'involuntary' in child custody proceedings as the absence of written consent by a parent or legal guardian. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include the term "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include the term "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. This involves inserting "involuntary" before specific terms in the Act to clarify the nature of these actions. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include the term "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. This involves inserting "involuntary" before specific terms in the Act to clarify the nature of these actions. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include the term "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. Written consent for child custody proceedings involving Indian children becomes irrevocable. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include "involuntary" in child custody proceedings, foster care placements, and termination of parental rights. Amendments include changing terms like "adoptive placement" to "involuntary foster care" and "adoptive" to "involuntary adoptive." The Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978 is amended to include "involuntary" before "child custody proceeding." The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of January 1, 1992 and will not apply to any permanent placement of an Indian child for adoption before the enactment of this Act.
